title: The Best NFL Mock Draft Simulators in 2024: A Complete Breakdown
shortDescription: Discover the top NFL mock draft simulators available in 2024, their strengths, weaknesses, and which one might be right for your draft preparation.
content:
If you love the NFL Draft, chances are you'll love mock draft simulators. And if you don't yet, it probably just means you haven't tried one.

The draft is unpredictable — that's what makes it so fun to watch. But (most) team have a process or logic behind the decisions they make: value, need, positional depth, upside. Mock draft simulators let you step into the chaos and strategy of it all — helping you form your own opinions on players, learn how teams think, and explore what your team could do before draft night even arrives.

Want to know what it's like to be a GM for your favorite team? Fire up a mock draft sim, make trades, weigh one player against another, and try to fill out a complete draft class. Before you know it, you might even find yourself in the film room watching highlight tapes and falling in love with a Day 3 sleeper.

Mock drafts are a great way to learn the league, learn the players, and build a better understanding of team-building. And if you're a college football fan? It's the perfect bridge to the NFL — follow your favorite prospects all the way through to draft weekend.

Bottom line: Get in the driver's seat. Have an opinion. Get ready for the draft. And have fun doing it.

## 1. Pro Football Network (PFN) Mock Draft Simulator

**Strengths:**

- Totally free to use, including trades and multi-round simulations
- Fast interface, clean user experience
- Offers basic team needs and player rankings
- Popular and trusted by many fans and analysts

**Weaknesses:**

- Pop-up ads and banner ads can clutter the interface
- Trade logic is simplistic, sometimes unrealistic
- Player rankings and board updates can lag behind industry trends

**Verdict:** A great all-around simulator for casual and experienced fans alike, but trade realism and ad intrusion could be improved.

## 2. Pro Football Focus (PFF) Mock Draft Simulator

**Strengths:**

- Premium user interface and clean design
- Trade logic is slightly more realistic than other simulators
- Custom draft board and multiple round flexibility
- Trusted source with deep scouting data

**Weaknesses:**

- Most features are locked behind a paywall ($9.99/month or $24.99/month)
- No free trade functionality unless you pay
- Occasionally slower load times during peak season

**Verdict:** High-end simulation tool for serious draft enthusiasts, but the paywall limits accessibility for the broader fan base.

## 3. NFL Mock Draft Database Simulator

**Strengths:**

- Free and fast to use
- Clean UI with basic trade support
- Compiles mock drafts from across the internet
- Regularly updated big board and team needs

**Weaknesses:**

- Trade logic is limited
- Less customization than other platforms
- Ads can impact mobile experience

**Verdict:** One of the more community-driven mock draft sims with good speed and accessibility. Lacks deeper strategic options but delivers on simplicity and ease of use.

## 4. StickToTheModel - A Transparent Self-Audit

**Strengths:**

- Built for fans who want both realism and speed
- Free to use, including trades, rankings, and team needs
- Designed to be mobile-friendly and ad-light
- Scouting logic driven by value-based grading and team need fit
- Real-time player rankings and intelligent pick evaluation

**Weaknesses:**

- Still early in development compared to more established simulators
- Trade logic and AI improvements are ongoing
- Some advanced features (like future pick trading, player comp overlays) are still in the roadmap phase

**Verdict:** Our mock draft simulator was designed to offer the best balance between realism, usability, and fun. While there's always room to grow, we're confident in the foundation and are rapidly improving based on user feedback.

## Final Thoughts: Which Mock Draft Simulator Is Best?

There's no one-size-fits-all answer. Pro Football Network delivers fast and accessible simulations. PFF offers a sleek and professional-grade experience for premium users. Mock Draft Database is ideal for quick runs and community insight. And our platform is focused on evolving into the most intuitive, accurate, and scalable tool available.

As we continue to improve our simulator, your feedback helps shape the future of mock draft season. Give it a spin and let us know what you think. Whether you're aiming to nail all 32 picks or just want to mock your team's next franchise QB, there's a mock draft sim out there for you—and we think ours is worth your next click.
